docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges idled through a listless week so far as business and rate fluctuations were concerned. For a pattern it followed closely that of the preceding fortnight of routine requirements at almost stable prices. The nominal character of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchanges idled through a listless week so far as business and rate fluctuations were concerned. For a pattern it followed closely that of the preceding fortnight of routine requirements at almost stable prices. The nominal character of the market was ascribed to the lessening of the tension surrounding the Rhineland incident, although at the week's close there was fresh apprehension over the Italo-Ethiopian affair.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED APRIL 18, 1936

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 25. -- Before sailing for Peru John L. Merrill, president of the Pan-American Society, declared yesterday that his six weeks' tour of Brazil, Uruguay, Argentina and Chile had given him the impression that cordiality was growing...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 25. -- Before sailing for Peru John L. Merrill, president of the Pan-American Society, declared yesterday that his six weeks' tour of Brazil, Uruguay, Argentina and Chile had given him the impression that cordiality was growing among the American peoples and sentiment was steadily crystallizing in favor of collective unity for mutual help in peace.

headline.main: FINDS RISING AMITY IN LATIN AMERICA; J.L. Merrill, Pan-American Society Head, Is Greeted as Friend in Chile. HE DECORATES ALESSANDRI Leaves for Peru After Expressing Optimism on Outlook of Buenos Aires Parley.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, May 2. -- Fighting men who lost their freedom in the long "War of the Chaco" between Paraguay and Bolivia started for their homelands tonight.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, May 2. -- Fighting men who lost their freedom in the long "War of the Chaco" between Paraguay and Bolivia started for their homelands tonight.
docs.abstract: Bolivia and Paraguay start repatriation of prisoners

headline.main: Bolivia and Paraguay Start Repatriation Of 20,000 Prisoners Captured in the Chaco

docs.snippet: Barring special weakness in the Swiss franc and Polish zloty, fluctuations in the other foreign exchanges last week were narrow and unimportant. Business was typical of that of the last several weeks, chiefly for routine requirements.
